newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Two killed, 65 injured in Taiwan train accident. [CORRECTED 16:58 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Two killed, 65 injured in Taiwan train accident. [CORRECTED 16:58 GMT]

text.p: Two people were killed and 65 injured when a gravel truck rammed into a moving train in central Taiwan late on Thursday, police said.
"The truck driver, identified as Chen Cheng-chin, 33, was killed instantly, while two cars of the train were derailed because of the impact," an officer told Reuters by telephone.
One of the train's 200 passengers was killed, police said. Five were critically injured.
Police said they were investigating the accident in Wujih.

It was the second accident involving a train in a week. On March 27 a passenger train derailed and smashed into a cement truck in northeastern Touchen, killing the truck driver and injuring 20 people. (Corrects total number of people injured from 200 to 20.)
